text: Based on the following function prototype and code fragment, which of the following correctly calls func()? double func(int, double, int *, int []); void main() { int a = 1, *b = &a, arr[5] = {0}, arr2[5][3] = {O}}; double Â¢ = 1.0; 3 //call to func } (a) func(*b, a, arr, arr2[1]); (b) int d = func(a, c, b, arr2); (c) double e = func(b, c, &arr[2], arr); (d) double f = func(*b, (double)a, arr2[0][0], arr2[2]);
